msContents.summary: Fragments not yet described. Seven plates

supportDesc.extent: 9 fragments of papyrus. The dimensions given are for the largest and smallest fragments respectively.129913818

handDesc.handNote: Likely written by one scribe, mostly in black ink with some red rubric.

decoDesc.decoNote: Polychrome decoration in white, black, and brown ink. Vignettes of a pastoral scene, a mummiform god, and the god Horus holding an ankh and was-sceptre.

history.acquisition: Bought from the Rev. G. J. Chester, 1890

recordHist.source: Summary description abbreviated from the Bodleian Libraries' unpublished card catalogue for otherwise-undescribed manuscripts, available in the Charles Wendell David Reading Room.

availability.p: This item may only be consulted by prior arrangement with a curator. To make an application, please click the request button above. When your request is received, you will be asked to contact the relevant person.

supportDesc.extent: 7 fragments of papyrus. The dimensions given are for the largest and smallest fragments respectively.119803742

handDesc.handNote: Likely written by one scribe, mostly in black ink with some red rubric.

decoDesc.decoNote: No vignettes accompany the text on these fragments.

history.acquisition: Bought from the Rev. G. J. Chester, 1890

supportDesc.extent: 3 fragments of papyrus. The dimensions given are for the largest and smallest fragments respectively.1548114688

handDesc.handNote: Likely written by one scribe, mostly in black ink with some red rubric.

decoDesc.decoNote: Polychrome decoration in red, blue, black, and brown. Two fragments feature vignettes of standing mummiform gods. The third fragment features a vignette of what appears to be a funerary casket or coffin.

history.acquisition: Bought from the Rev. G. J. Chester, 1890

decoDesc.decoNote: Fragmentary vignettes of human legs can be seen at the top of two of the fragments.
